channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Incorrect Sign in Private Communal Garden in Fisher Close, 20th October
item.description:
Hello Southwark Council has fixed a council sign prohibiting ball games on the bike shed in the communal garden in Fisher Close. This is private property and not run by the council. The neighbouring block of flats on Fisher Close also has a bike shed and IS council property. Perhaps the sign was meant to go there? Either way can you remove the sign please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 51-59, Salter Road, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of old and broken furniture abandoned on Camelot close., 20th October
item.description:
There are our back garden. Those old furniture are dirty and full of bacteria. Especially after raining, you can find bad smell from the abandoned furniture. It would cause the environment badly. People walk along the place may be injured accidentally.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Broadwater Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water leaking out of drain and into basement flat, 20th October
item.description:
There is a large amount of water pouring out of a drain in front of Crespidia cafe, which is leaking through into the communal areas of my apartment block 51-53 Anerley Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 41, Anerley Road, Crystal Palace, London

item.title: Roots of large tree pushing up patio, 20th October
item.description:
This tree, which is just behind my garden fence, has grown up very quickly to be much bigger than we were told it would and now itâ€™s its roots have started to impact my patio. The slabs are being pushed up in an uneven manor causing a potential trip hazard every time I use the walkway next to my garage which is a constant access route to my car and my rubbish bins. As a vulnerable senior citizen with cancer I am obviously concerned about potential falls.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rutland Avenue, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose paving stones outside No. 97, 20th October
item.description:
This problem has been here for at least a month. Someone could trip and fall. It wobbles as people walk on it. The next stone is also loose.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wilberforce Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Vehicle abandoned in middle of road, 20th October
item.description:
Reg PN16EJO A vehicle appears to be abandoned, with hazards on, in the process of leaving a junction at Heath Road and Wansunt Road. Nobody appears to be with the vehicle. First spotted at 10:20am. At 1:30pm the vehicle is still there. I'm unsure if the vehicle is broken down or not.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Heath Road, Coldblow, London

item.title: Parking Abuse, 20th October
item.description:
A van has been parked in the same spot for about two weeks. This is a busy street with limited parking, and the van is restricting access for neighbours, delivery vehicles, and people with mobility or other special needs. If the van needs to remain for a long period, it would be better placed at the end of the street where there are no houses. Please can this be looked at to ensure the street remains accessible for everyone.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Montrell Road, Streatham Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: URG leesons jn murray rd broken barrel bollard OOG with insitu 2'' trip, 20th October
item.description:
,I inspected the site this morning & noted the trip hazard had not been rectified & the large piece of barrel bollard has been rolled slightly downhill to the edge of the kerbline(highly dangerous). I must state that the lack of inaction at this location is worrying as the inspection procedure appears to be suspect having marked this as URGENT report. On Sat, 27 Sept 2025 at 16:14, Dear All, for urgent attention
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 39, Leesons Hill, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly-tipped furniture and rubbish on pavement again, 20th October
item.description:
Several pieces of dumped furniture and household items have been left on the pavement beside the brick building. The items include wooden panels or parts of furniture, a plastic bucket, and other debris. This is an ongoing issue in the area, as people keep dumping rubbish here regularly. Unfortunately, the problem continues because no action seems to be taken to prevent further fly-tipping

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cottingham Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet
